node.excerpt: We are looking forward to getting started.

node.title: Some tickets left for Thursday

node.excerpt: From disposable – to reuseable!

node.title: Erykah Badu plays Øya on August 8th!
node.excerpt: Finally back in Norway!

node.title: Tame Impala and Pond to play Øya on Thursday August 8th
node.excerpt: Saturday sold out, under 50% of the week passes left

node.title: Robyn will headline Friday 9th of August
node.excerpt: We’ve had a very good start, and three headliners are already in place. The Cure and Norwegian duo Karpe have been announced in the last few weeks, and now we’re excited to day that we have Robyn confirmed. This will be her only festival show in Norway in 2019. All our tickets are on sale now.

node.title: The Cure to headline Øya Wednesday 7th of August
node.excerpt: First headliner for 2019. Tickets on sale now!

node.title: b’Arte by Tor Erik Bøe
node.excerpt: This year’s festival artist transforms people’s faces into unique works of art!

node.title: Øya 2018 is sold out.
node.excerpt: Tickets selling faster than ever!

node.title: ARCTIC MONKEYS to headline Øya’s Wednesday
node.excerpt: One of England’s most important rock bands in recent years are back! Arctic Monkeys will headline in Tøyenparken on Wednesday 8th of August.

node.title: Kendrick Lamar to headline Øya on Thursday 9th of August
node.excerpt: Part of a new generation of West coast rappers, Lamar is a rare breed of artist: one that has achieved commercial success whilst maintaining coveted tastemaker status amongst the critical elite.

node.title: Arcade Fire, Lykke Li and more added to 2018 line-up
node.excerpt: Day tickets and week passes for sale!

node.title: Tickets for sale
node.excerpt: The first 11 acts for Øya 2018 are confirmed. More to be announced before Christmas!

node.title: Øya 2017 is sold out
node.excerpt: See you in August!

node.title: Pixies headline Øya on Friday
node.excerpt: Both day tickets and week passes are on sale.

node.title: Cashmere Cat will play Øya Friday 11th of August
node.excerpt: Norway’s newest superstar headline our Sirkus tent Friday.

node.title: Spiritualized with Oslo Philharmonic at Øya
node.excerpt: Lana Del Rey, Young Thug, Testament, Danny Brown, Bel Canto, SIBIIR and many others also play in Tøyenparken this day.

node.title: TAKE PART IN MAKING OYA 2017!

node.title: Lana Del Rey to headline Øya
node.excerpt: One of the latest year’s biggest pop sensation will headline Wednesday.

node.title: The xx avslutter Øya-torsdagen
node.excerpt: Over halvparten av ukespassene er solgt!

node.title: Øya-publikummets favorittmusikk fra 2016
node.excerpt: Det ble stemt på til sammen nesten 300 ulike utgivelser, så variasjonen var stor. Her er de 28 mest populære. De fem øverste var klare favoritter. Vi har trukket Maria Petra Brandal Nilsson og Ole Erling Johannesen som vinnere av ukespass til Øya 2017. De blir kontakta i løpet av dagen. Nå vender vi blikket […]

node.title: Årets utenlandske utgivelse
node.excerpt: Anderson .Paak topper Øya-kontorets lengste liste.

node.title: Lana Del Rey til Øya onsdag 9. august
node.excerpt: En av de siste åras største popsensasjoner avslutter den første kvelden i Tøyenparken.

node.title: Tre nye navn på plakaten
node.excerpt: Vince Staples og BadBadNotGood spiller lørdag 12. august. Nls Bech er også bekrefta.

node.title: Årets norske utgivelse
node.excerpt: Electric Eye på topp! Vi har på uhøytidelig vis laga en liste med det vi mener er de aller sterkeste norske utgivelsene fra 2016.

node.title: Tre fantastiske til Øya
node.excerpt: Mac DeMarco, Silja Sol og Julia Jacklin kommer til Tøyenparken.

node.title: Hva slags effekt har Øyas miljøsatsning?
node.excerpt: Vi har gjort litt førjulsmatte for dere.

node.title: Øya 2016 is sold out
node.excerpt: The last tickets were sold last night

node.title: Massive Attack play Øya on Wednesday 10th of August
node.excerpt: Will bring Young Fathers as part of their show

node.title: Eagles Of Death Metal ready for Øya
node.excerpt: We are really happy that Eagles Of Death Metal are not letting the tragedy that happened in Paris last November stop them from touring Europe. On Friday 12th of August, they are back in Oslo to rock’n’roll.

featured_image.title: eagles of death metal oyafestivalen 2016 crop
featured_image.name: eagles-of-death-metal-oyafestivalen-2016-crop-2

node.title: Highasakite will headline Friday 12th of August
node.excerpt: This year our Norwegian headliner will be Highasakite. The concert will be one of very few they do in Norway this year, and the first in Oslo after the release of the album Camp Echo.

node.title: Mastodon will finally play Øya
node.excerpt: Mastodon is one of the most important rock bands of the past 10 years, and has set new standards with their very own mix of metal, prog, hard rock and psychedelia. The band will play to their loyal Norwegian fans on Thursday 11th of August.

node.title: New Order will play Friday 12th of August
node.excerpt: Music Complete, New Order’s album from last year, got a lot of praise and proved they are still a fantastic and innovative band.

node.title: PJ Harvey will play Øya
node.excerpt: In Tøyenparken Thursday 11th of August

node.title: Jason Isbell added to Øya line-up
node.excerpt: Will play Tøyenparken on Wednesday 10th of August

node.title: Jamie xx, Chvrches and Stormzy added to Øya line-up

wordpressPage.title: Volunteer
wordpressPage.content:
We have now closed volunteer applications for Øya 2019
As a volunteer at Øya, you get a unique experience, a chance to work in the background and be part of what makes the festival go round.

Be quick to register and your chances are higher for getting exactly the job you want. However, we advise that you read all of the information on this page before registering.

Oh! By the way: To volunteer at Øya you must be over 18 years old on the first festival day, i.e the 7th of August.

What does it mean to be a volunteer? What do we expect from you?

We offer a wide range of different volunteer jobs. You do not need to have any prior festival experience, but we hope you have a contagious good mood, whether the sun is shining or it is raining cats and dogs. We expect you to show up on time and contribute to the best of your ability until your work session is over. As a reward, we guarantee you an unforgettable experience, great music, tasty organic food, eternal gratitude and then some.

What kind of jobs can I get?

Here are some tasks you can get as a volunteer:

  • Rigging – up or dismantling of fences, tents, etc.
  • Security – ensure that everyone is doing well at the festival and not get lost in the festival area.
  • Bar – tap and sell beer, soda, snacks and other bar merch to our guests.
  • Drivers – drive to and from the festival area with equipment and people
  • Cooking – help to create good organic food for volunteers and artists
  • Delta Force – The festival «all in one» force that works everywhere at the festival, where needed, when needed.
  • Furniture Group – Assist with the assembly and installation of furniture – prior to and / or after the festival.
  • Order Central – Procurement of Equipment in / dispensing equipment from the festival area.
  • Popcorn store- Selling popcorn and other snacks.

Unfortunately we cannot guarantee that everybody will get exactly the job they want or the days they want to work, but we will do our very best to make sure that happens.

How much do I work?
It varies a bit how much you work according to the job you do. Generally one can say that you work one day and then get one day free admission to the festival. If you work during the festival, you have to work two days to get the other two days off.

PS! Questions? Send us an e-mail
